name: Cultural Literacy in the Digital Age
description: This course examines two related debates about digital media in education: first, how best to integrate digital technology into learning (digital or computer literacy), and, secondly, what knowledge is required for full cultural participation (cultural literacy). We examine these issues using a range of academic, general interest and discipline-specific sources.
prerequisites: WDW235H1 and WDW236H1; open to students not taking the Digital Humanities Minor by permission of the program coordinator.
